description.narrative: Overall Objective of Project: AMCOW provides a high-level platform to push the water agenda forward at the continental, regional and country levels, ultimately enabling member states to ensure sustainable management of water resources to address both poverty reduction and social development goals. Within the broader scope of AMCOW Strategy 2018-2030, the specific objectives of the Project are: 1: Representation and Engagement - AMCOW more effectively serves as the Working Group on Water and Sanitation of the African Union’s STC on Agriculture, Rural Development, Water and Environment. 2: Financing - AMCOW is successful in attracting and leveraging more financial resources to ensure a more sustainable Secretariat and to support the implementation of the 2018-2030 Strategy. 3: Influencing Policy and Practice / Knowledge Broker - To increase the use of research and best practice by policy-makers, private companies, non-governmental organizations, community based organizations and public institutions, etc.

Det Afrikanska Ministerrådet för Vattenfrågor (AMCOW) har ansökt hos Sida om finansiering med 40 Miljoner SEK för genomförandet av institutionell kapacitetsutveckling av AMCOW sekretariatet i perioden 2019 – 2022. Insatsen ska möjliggöra för AMCOW att leverera i enlighet med sitt mandat och att genomföra sin nyligen antagna strategi 2018 – 2030. Detta ska i sin tur bidra till att AMCOWs 55 medlemsländer ska kunna förvalta sina vattenresurser på ett miljömässigt hållbart sätt och därigenom även uppnå fattigdomsminskning och andra utvecklingsmål. Projektet ämnas stärka AMCOW som organisation med särskilt fokus på Sekretariatets kapacitet att 1) på ett effektivt sätt fungera som arbetsgrupp för vatten och sanitet under Afrikanska Unionens Särskilda Tekniska Kommitté för Landsbygdsutveckling, vatten och miljö (STC ARDWE); 2) säkerställa en hållbar finansiering för organisationen och genomförandet av AMCOWs Strategi 2018 – 2030; och 3) att påverka policyutveckling och genomförande.
AMCOW sekretariatet kommer genomföra projektet och teckna avtal med Ambassaden för ett totalt stöd på 40 miljoner SEK. Rapportering kommer ske enligt en projektspecifik budget och resultatramverk. Eftersom projektet nära kopplar till AMCOWs kärnverksamhet, vilken även finansiera av AMCOWs medlemsländer och andra givare, så kommer Sekretariatet vara ansvarigt för att koordinering sker löpande. Det Sida finansierade projektet ska diskuteras på AMCOWs årliga möten med deltagande av medlemsländer och givare. Rapporterna kommer vara offentliga och tillgängliga på AMCOWs hemsida för transparens. Sida projektet kommer dessutom specifikt att bidra till ökad givarkoordinering.
Beredning har gjorts i nära samarbete med controllers från Sida Stockholm och Ambassaden, samt med handläggare på ambassaden i Addis Abeba och har innefattat två besök på AMCOW Sekretariatet (Controllers besökte organisationen under två dagar i Oktober 2018, Chef för regionala sektionen samt Sveriges Ambassadör till Nigeria besökte Sekretariatet i November 2018), workshop med representanter från AMCOWs medlemsländer under AMCOW årsmöte i Gabon i oktober 2018, bedömning av Sidas Help Desk för Miljöfrågor (Augusti 2018) samt stöd från experter på resultat styrning, Associates for International Management Services (AIMS, oktober – november 2018). Kvalitetssäkring med hjälp av både externa och interna aktörer har på detta vis byggts in i processen från början.

The African Ministerial Council on Water (AMCOW) has applied to Sida for funding of 40 million SEK to carry out the Institutional Strengthening of the AMCOW Secretariat during the period 2019 – 2022. The intervention aims at enabling AMCOW to fulfill its mandate and implement its strategy, enabling member states to ensure sustainable management of water resources to address both poverty reduction and social development goals. This is to be done by strengthening the AMCOW organs, and in particular the Secretariat to 1) more effectively serve as the Working Group on Water and Sanitation of the African Union’s STC on Agriculture, Rural Development, Water and Environment; 2) leverage more financial resources to ensure a more sustainable Secretariat and to support the implementation of the 2018-2030 Strategy; and 3) to influence policy and practice through the use of research and best practice by policy-makers, private companies, non-governmental organizations, community-based organizations and public institutions.
The AMCOW Secretariat will implement the intervention. The institutional support is set up as a project with a total budget of 40 million SEK. Reporting will be delivered on the project specific results framework and budget in the proposal. AMCOW core costs and activities are also financed by AMCOW member states and other donors. Coordination will occur annually at the meetings of AMCOW governing bodies. The Sida contribution will also contribute to establishing a strategic dialogue with donors for enhanced coordination.
The appraisal was prepared in close collaboration with controllers from Sida headquarters and the Embassy in Addis Ababa as well as with the program officer for environment and climate at the regional section at the Embassy. It has involved two visits t the AMCOW Secretariat in Abuja, in October by the controllers and in November by the head of the Regional Section at the Embassy and the Swedish Ambassador to Nigeria. Sida was present at the annual meeting of AMCOW governing organs in Gabon in October 2018, and a workshop was organized with the member states representatives to the Technical Advisory Committee (TAC). Sida’s Help Desk on environmental issues was involved at an early stage to map out the relevance and added value of AMCOW, and Sida also procured support by results-based management experts at Associates for International Management Services (AIMS) to assist AMCOW in the preparation of the project proposal. The quality assurance has thus been built in to the process.

tag.narrative: 6.1 - By 2030, achieve universal and equitable access to safe and affordable drinking water for all.
6.1 - Senast 2030 uppnå allmän och rättvis tillgång till säkert och ekonomiskt överkomligt dricksvatten för alla.

6.2 - By 2030, achieve access to adequate and equitable sanitation and hygiene for all and end open defecation, paying special attention to the needs of women and girls and those in vulnerable situations.

6.2 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla har tillgång till fullgod och rättvis sanitet och hygien och att ingen behöver uträtta sina behov utomhus. Särskild uppmärksamhet bör ägnas åt behoven hos kvinnor och flickor samt människor i utsatta situationer.
6.5 - By 2030, implement integrated water resources management at all levels, including through transboundary cooperation as appropriate.
6.5 - Senast 2030 genomföra en integrerad förvaltning av vattenresurser på alla nivåer, när så är lämpligt genom gränsöverskridande samarbete.

6.a - By 2030, expand international cooperation and capacity-building support to developing countries in water- and sanitation-related activities and programmes, including water harvesting, desalination, water efficiency, wastewater treatment, recycling and reuse technologies.

6.a - Till 2030 utöka det internationella samarbetet och stödet för kapacitetsuppbyggnad till utvecklingsländerna inom vatten- och sanitetsrelaterade verksamheter och program, inklusive genom tekniker för vatteninsamling, avsaltning, vatteneffektivitet, rening av avloppsvatten, återvinning och återanvändning.

description.narrative: The results reporting from AMCOW has so far been focused on activity level, and less on outcome level results. Having the annual reporting more devoted to higher level results and analysis, and the semi-annual reporting detailing the activity level results has been proposed by Sida and is expected to improve the quality of the reporting. That being said, reports have been of good quality and does show that AMCOW is on its way in reaching the expected targets. Indicators for the three result areas are mainly in line with projections. Some delays have been experienced partly due to interruptions in recruitment and due to the Covid-19 pandemic. The latter has restricted international travels and engagement with stakeholders in the region. AMCOW has however been rather successful in moving to digital solutions for meeting and workshops. Examples of results per outcome area are presented below: 1: Representation and Engagement - The AMCOW Secretariat organized the 12th Ordinary Session of the Executive Committee (EXCO). Prior to the Ministerial Session, the Secretariat facilitated and organized a Technical Advisory Committee (TAC) Session. The 12th EXCO made a number of decisions whose implementation is expected to contribute to the overall achievement of the objectives of the Sida contribution; approval of AMCOW’s 5-Year Strategic Operational Plan (SOP) running from 2020 to 2024; approval of policies and procedures related to better financial and human resources management; and a directive for the Secretariat to proceed with preparations and planning for the 8th Africa Water Week. - Organization of sub-regional meetings providing an opportunity for members states to interact with the AMCOW Secretariat to discuss the AMCOW Strategy 2018-2030 and SOP 2020-2024, including country contributions to AMCOW. 2: Financing - Deployment of a the new Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) System including components for Financial Management and for Human Capital Management. The new ERP has improved the quality of reports generated for different stakeholders and has enhanced operational efficiencies in transaction processing. The Secretariat is still building staff capacity and making adjustments to the system to make it fully optimal. - Continued efforts to make member states to pay their annual member fees and outstanding balances where appropriate. This was supported by targeted visits by the Executive Secretary to selected member states to strengthen the relationship between AMCOW and member states through presentation of AMCOW strategy and plan, AMCOW institutional strengthening process and service delivery plans, financial needs and sustainability plan. 3: Influencing Policy and Practice / Knowledge Broker - The AMCOW Library and Information Centre has been established and is now functional. - Creation of a web-based "Knowledge Hub of Hubs": The development of the knowledge hub has reached its final phase and a revamping of the AMCOW website revamping including a more user-friendly interface.
